an4.200:1.5.eng: fondness is born of hate, and

an4.200:2.1.eng: And how is fondness born of fondness?

an4.200:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalassa iṭṭho hoti kanto manāpo.
an4.200:2.2.eng: It’s when someone likes, loves, and cares for an individual.

an4.200:2.3.pli: Taṃ pare iṭṭhena kantena manāpena samudācaranti.
an4.200:2.3.eng: Others treat them with liking, love, and care.

an4.200:2.5.pli: ‘yo kho myāyaṃ puggalo iṭṭho kanto manāpo, taṃ pare iṭṭhena kantena manāpena samudācarantī’ti.
an4.200:2.5.eng: ‘These others like the individual I like.’

an4.200:2.6.eng: And so fondness for them springs up.

an4.200:2.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pemā pemaṃ jāyati.
an4.200:2.7.eng: That’s how fondness is born of fondness.

an4.200:3.1.eng: And how is hate born of fondness?

an4.200:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalassa iṭṭho hoti kanto manāpo.
an4.200:3.2.eng: It’s when someone likes, loves, and cares for an individual.

an4.200:3.3.pli: Taṃ pare aniṭṭhena akantena amanāpena samudācaranti.
an4.200:3.3.eng: Others treat them with disliking, loathing, and detestation.

an4.200:3.5.pli: ‘yo kho myāyaṃ puggalo iṭṭho kanto manāpo, taṃ pare aniṭṭhena akantena amanāpena samudācarantī’ti.
an4.200:3.5.eng: ‘These others dislike the individual I like.’

an4.200:3.6.eng: And so hate for them springs up.

an4.200:3.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pemā doso jāyati.
an4.200:3.7.eng: That’s how hate is born of fondness.

an4.200:4.1.eng: And how is fondness born of hate?

an4.200:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalassa aniṭṭho hoti akanto amanāpo.
an4.200:4.2.eng: It’s when someone dislikes, loathes, and detests an individual.

an4.200:4.3.pli: Taṃ pare aniṭṭhena akantena amanāpena samudācaranti.
an4.200:4.3.eng: Others treat them with disliking, loathing, and detestation.

an4.200:4.5.pli: ‘yo kho myāyaṃ puggalo aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo, taṃ pare aniṭṭhena akantena amanāpena samudācarantī’ti.
an4.200:4.5.eng: ‘These others dislike the individual I dislike.’

an4.200:4.6.eng: And so fondness for them springs up.

an4.200:4.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dosā pemaṃ jāyati.
an4.200:4.7.eng: That’s how fondness is born of hate.

an4.200:5.1.eng: And how is hate born of hate?

an4.200:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, puggalo puggalassa aniṭṭho hoti akanto amanāpo.
an4.200:5.2.eng: It’s when someone dislikes, loathes, and detests an individual.

an4.200:5.3.pli: Taṃ pare iṭṭhena kantena manāpena samudācaranti.
an4.200:5.3.eng: Others treat them with liking, love, and care.

an4.200:5.5.pli: ‘yo kho myāyaṃ puggalo aniṭṭho akanto amanāpo, taṃ pare iṭṭhena kantena manāpena samudācarantī’ti.
an4.200:5.5.eng: ‘These others like the individual I dislike.’

an4.200:5.6.eng: And so hate for them springs up.

an4.200:5.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dosā doso jāyati.
an4.200:5.7.eng: That’s how hate is born of hate.

an4.200:5.8.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, cattāri pemāni jāyanti.
an4.200:5.8.eng: These are the four things that are born of fondness and hate.

an4.200:6.1.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati,
an4.200:6.1.eng: A time comes when a mendicant … enters and remains in the first absorption.

an4.200:6.2.pli: yampissa pemā pemaṃ jāyati tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, yopissa pemā doso jāyati sopissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, yampissa dosā pemaṃ jāyati tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, yopissa dosā doso jāyati sopissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an4.200:6.2.eng: At that time they have no fondness born of fondness, hate born of fondness, fondness born of hate, or hate born of hate.

an4.200:7.1.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā …pe… dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ …pe… tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ …pe… catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati,
an4.200:7.1.eng: A time comes when a mendicant … enters and remains in the second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption.

an4.200:7.2.pli: yampissa pemā pemaṃ jāyati tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, yopissa pemā doso jāyati sopissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, yampissa dosā pemaṃ jāyati tampissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti, yopissa dosā doso jāyati sopissa tasmiṃ samaye na hoti.
an4.200:7.2.eng: At that time they have no fondness born of fondness, hate born of fondness, fondness born of hate, or hate born of hate.

an4.200:8.1.pli: Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati, yampissa pemā pemaṃ jāyati tampissa pahīnaṃ hoti ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṅkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ, yopissa pemā doso jāyati sopissa pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo,
an4.200:8.1.eng: A time comes when a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an4.200:8.2.pli: yampissa dosā pemaṃ jāyati tampissa pahīnaṃ hoti ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṅkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ, yopissa dosā doso jāyati sopissa pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.
an4.200:8.2.eng: At that time any fondness born of fondness, hate born of fondness, fondness born of hate, or hate born of hate is given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

an4.200:8.3.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu neva usseneti na paṭiseneti na dhūpāyati na pajjalati na sampajjhāyati.
an4.200:8.3.eng: This is called a mendicant who doesn’t draw close or push back or fume or ignite or burn up.

an4.200:9.1.eng: And how does a mendicant draw close?

an4.200:9.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā rūpaṃ, rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:9.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant regards form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.

an4.200:9.3.pli: vedanaṃ attato samanupassati, vedanāvantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā vedanaṃ, vedanāya vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:9.3.eng: They regard feeling as self, self as having feeling, feeling in self, or self in feeling.

an4.200:9.4.pli: saññaṃ attato samanupassati, saññāvantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā saññaṃ, saññāya vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:9.4.eng: They regard perception as self, self as having perception, perception in self, or self in perception.

an4.200:9.5.pli: saṅkhāre attato samanupassati, saṅkhāravantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā saṅkhāre, saṅkhāresu vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:9.5.eng: They regard choices as self, self as having choices, choices in self, or self in choices.

an4.200:9.6.pli: viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassati, viññāṇavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
an4.200:9.6.eng: They regard consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.

an4.200:9.7.eng: That’s how a mendicant draws close.

an4.200:10.1.eng: And how does a mendicant not draw close?

an4.200:10.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:10.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.

an4.200:10.3.pli: na vedanaṃ attato samanupassati, na vedanāvantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā vedanaṃ, na vedanāya vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:10.3.eng: They don’t regard feeling as self, self as having feeling, feeling in self, or self in feeling.

an4.200:10.4.pli: na saññaṃ attato samanupassati, na saññāvantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā saññaṃ, na saññāya vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:10.4.eng: They don’t regard perception as self, self as having perception, perception in self, or self in perception.

an4.200:10.5.pli: na saṅkhāre attato samanupassati, na saṅkhāravantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā saṅkhāre, na saṅkhāresu vā attānaṃ;
an4.200:10.5.eng: They don’t regard choices as self, self as having choices, choices in self, or self in choices.

an4.200:10.6.pli: na viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassati, na viññāṇavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, na attani vā viññāṇaṃ, na viññāṇasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
an4.200:10.6.eng: They don’t regard consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.

an4.200:10.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na usseneti.
an4.200:10.7.eng: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t draw close.

an4.200:11.1.eng: And how does a mendicant push back?

an4.200:11.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkosantaṃ paccakkosati, rosantaṃ paṭirosati, bhaṇḍantaṃ paṭibhaṇḍati.
an4.200:11.2.eng: It’s when someone abuses, annoys, or argues with a mendicant, and the mendicant abuses, annoys, or argues back at them.

an4.200:11.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant pushes back.

an4.200:12.1.eng: And how does a mendicant not push back?

an4.200:12.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkosantaṃ na paccakkosati, rosantaṃ na paṭirosati, bhaṇḍantaṃ na paṭibhaṇḍati.
an4.200:12.2.eng: It’s when someone abuses, annoys, or argues with a mendicant, and the mendicant doesn’t abuse, annoy, or argue back at them.

an4.200:12.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na paṭiseneti.
an4.200:12.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t push back.

an4.200:13.1.eng: And how does a mendicant fume?

an4.200:13.2.pli: Asmīti, bhikkhave, sati itthasmīti hoti, evaṃsmīti hoti, aññathāsmīti hoti, asasmīti hoti, satasmīti hoti, santi hoti, itthaṃ santi hoti, evaṃ santi hoti, aññathā santi hoti, apihaṃ santi hoti, apihaṃ itthaṃ santi hoti, apihaṃ evaṃ santi hoti, apihaṃ aññathā santi hoti, bhavissanti hoti, itthaṃ bhavissanti hoti, evaṃ bhavissanti hoti, aññathā bhavissanti hoti.
an4.200:13.2.eng: When there is the concept ‘I am’, there are the concepts ‘I am such’, ‘I am thus’, ‘I am otherwise’; ‘I am fleeting’, ‘I am lasting’; ‘mine’, ‘such is mine’, ‘thus is mine’, ‘otherwise is mine’; ‘also mine’, ‘such is also mine’, ‘thus is also mine’, ‘otherwise is also mine’; ‘I will be’, ‘I will be such’, ‘I will be thus’, ‘I will be otherwise’.

an4.200:14.1.eng: And how does a mendicant not fume?

an4.200:14.2.pli: Asmīti, bhikkhave, asati itthasmīti na hoti, evaṃsmīti na hoti, aññathāsmīti na hoti, asasmīti na hoti, satasmīti na hoti, santi na hoti, itthaṃ santi na hoti, evaṃ santi na hoti, aññathā santi na hoti, apihaṃ santi na hoti, apihaṃ itthaṃ santi na hoti, apihaṃ evaṃ santi na hoti, apihaṃ aññathā santi na hoti, bhavissanti na hoti, itthaṃ bhavissanti na hoti, evaṃ bhavissanti na hoti, aññathā bhavissanti na hoti.
an4.200:14.2.eng: When there is no concept ‘I am’, there are no concepts ‘I am such’, ‘I am thus’, ‘I am otherwise’; ‘I am fleeting’, ‘I am lasting’; ‘mine’, ‘such is mine’, ‘thus is mine’, ‘otherwise is mine’; ‘also mine’, ‘such is also mine’, ‘thus is also mine’, ‘otherwise is also mine’; ‘I will be’, ‘I will be such’, ‘I will be thus’, ‘I will be otherwise’.

an4.200:14.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na dhūpāyati.
an4.200:14.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant doesn’t fume.

an4.200:15.1.eng: And how is a mendicant ignited?

an4.200:15.2.pli: Iminā asmīti, bhikkhave, sati iminā itthasmīti hoti, iminā evaṃsmīti hoti, iminā aññathāsmīti hoti, iminā asasmīti hoti, iminā satasmīti hoti, iminā santi hoti, iminā itthaṃ santi hoti, iminā evaṃ santi hoti, iminā aññathā santi hoti, iminā apihaṃ santi hoti, iminā apihaṃ itthaṃ santi hoti, iminā apihaṃ evaṃ santi hoti, iminā apihaṃ aññathā santi hoti, iminā bhavissanti hoti, iminā itthaṃ bhavissanti hoti, iminā evaṃ bhavissanti hoti, iminā aññathā bhavissanti hoti.
an4.200:15.2.eng: When there is the concept ‘I am because of this’, there are the concepts ‘I am such because of this’, ‘I am thus because of this’, ‘I am otherwise because of this’; ‘I am fleeting because of this’, ‘I am lasting because of this’; ‘mine because of this’, ‘such is mine because of this’, ‘thus is mine because of this’, ‘otherwise is mine because of this’; ‘also mine because of this’, ‘such is also mine because of this’, ‘thus is also mine because of this’, ‘otherwise is also mine because of this’; ‘I will be because of this’, ‘I will be such because of this’, ‘I will be thus because of this’, ‘I will be otherwise because of this’.

an4.200:15.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant is ignited.

an4.200:16.1.eng: And how is a mendicant not ignited?

an4.200:16.2.pli: Iminā asmīti, bhikkhave, asati iminā itthasmīti na hoti, iminā evaṃsmīti na hoti, iminā aññathāsmīti na hoti, iminā asasmīti na hoti, iminā satasmīti na hoti, iminā santi na hoti, iminā itthaṃ santi na hoti, iminā evaṃ santi na hoti, iminā aññathā santi na hoti, iminā apihaṃ santi na hoti, iminā apihaṃ itthaṃ santi na hoti, iminā apihaṃ evaṃ santi na hoti, iminā apihaṃ aññathā santi na hoti, iminā bhavissanti na hoti, iminā itthaṃ bhavissanti na hoti, iminā evaṃ bhavissanti na hoti, iminā aññathā bhavissanti na hoti.
an4.200:16.2.eng: When there is no concept ‘I am because of this’, there are no concepts ‘I am such because of this’, ‘I am thus because of this’, ‘I am otherwise because of this’; ‘I am fleeting because of this’, ‘I am lasting because of this’; ‘mine because of this’, ‘such is mine because of this’, ‘thus is mine because of this’, ‘otherwise is mine because of this’; ‘also mine because of this’, ‘such is also mine because of this’, ‘thus is also mine because of this’, ‘otherwise is also mine because of this’; ‘I will be because of this’, ‘I will be such because of this’, ‘I will be thus because of this’, ‘I will be otherwise because of this’.

an4.200:16.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na pajjalati.
an4.200:16.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant is not ignited.

an4.200:17.1.eng: And how does a mendicant burn up?

an4.200:17.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno asmimāno pahīno na hoti ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.
an4.200:17.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant hasn’t given up the conceit ‘I am’, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.

an4.200:17.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant is burned up.

an4.200:18.1.eng: And how does a mendicant not burn up?

an4.200:18.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno asmimāno pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.
an4.200:18.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant has given up the conceit ‘I am’, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.

an4.200:18.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na sampajjhāyatī”ti.
an4.200:18.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant is not burned up.”

an4.201:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you an untrue person and an even more untrue person,

an4.201:1.2.eng: a true person and an even truer person.

an4.201:1.3.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an4.201:1.3.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an4.201:1.4.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an4.201:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī hoti.
an4.201:2.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, lies, and consumes beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an4.201:2.3.eng: This is called an untrue person.

an4.201:3.1.eng: And what is an even more untrue person?

an4.201:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātī hoti, parañca pāṇātipāte samādapeti;
an4.201:3.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, lies, and consumes beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. And they encourage others to do these things.

an4.201:3.3.pli: attanā ca adinnādāyī hoti, parañca adinnādāne samādapeti;

an4.201:3.4.pli: attanā ca kāmesumicchācārī hoti, parañca kāmesumicchācāre samādapeti;

an4.201:3.5.pli: attanā ca musāvādī hoti, parañca musāvāde samādapeti;

an4.201:3.6.pli: attanā ca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī hoti, parañca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāne samādapeti.

an4.201:3.7.eng: This is called an even more untrue person.

an4.201:4.1.eng: And what is a true person?

an4.201:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.
an4.201:4.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an4.201:4.3.eng: This is called a true person.

an4.201:5.1.eng: And what is an even truer person?

an4.201:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, parañca pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
an4.201:5.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. And they encourage others to refrain from these things.

an4.201:5.3.pli: attanā ca adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, parañca adinnādānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.201:5.4.pli: attanā ca kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, parañca kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.201:5.5.pli: attanā ca musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, parañca musāvādā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.201:5.6.pli: attanā ca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti, parañca surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.

an4.201:5.7.eng: This is called an even truer person.”

an4.202:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you an untrue person and an even more untrue person,

an4.202:1.2.eng: a true person and an even truer person.

an4.202:2.1.eng: And what is an untrue person?

an4.202:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, appassuto hoti, kusīto hoti, muṭṭhassati hoti, duppañño hoti.
an4.202:2.2.eng: It’s someone who is faithless, shameless, imprudent, with little learning, lazy, unmindful, and witless.

an4.202:2.3.eng: This is called an untrue person.

an4.202:3.1.eng: And what is an even more untrue person?

an4.202:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca assaddho hoti, parañca assaddhiye samādapeti;
an4.202:3.2.eng: It’s someone who is faithless, shameless, imprudent, with little learning, lazy, confused, and witless. And they encourage others in these same qualities.

an4.202:3.3.pli: attanā ca ahiriko hoti, parañca ahirikatāya samādapeti;

an4.202:3.4.pli: attanā ca anottappī hoti, parañca anottappe samādapeti;

an4.202:3.5.pli: attanā ca appassuto hoti, parañca appassute samādapeti;

an4.202:3.6.pli: attanā ca kusīto hoti, parañca kosajje samādapeti;

an4.202:3.7.pli: attanā ca muṭṭhassati hoti, parañca muṭṭhassacce samādapeti;

an4.202:3.8.pli: attanā ca duppañño hoti, parañca duppaññatāya samādapeti.

an4.202:3.9.eng: This is called an even more untrue person.

an4.202:4.1.eng: And what is a true person?

an4.202:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco saddho hoti, hirimā hoti, ottappī hoti, bahussuto hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, satimā hoti, paññavā hoti.
an4.202:4.2.eng: It’s someone who is faithful, conscientious, prudent, learned, energetic, mindful, and wise.

an4.202:4.3.eng: This is called a true person.

an4.202:5.1.eng: And what is an even truer person?

an4.202:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca saddhāsampanno hoti, parañca saddhāsampadāya samādapeti;
an4.202:5.2.eng: It’s someone who is personally accomplished in faith, conscience, prudence, learning, energy, mindfulness, and wisdom. And they encourage others in these same qualities.

an4.202:5.3.pli: attanā ca hirimā hoti, parañca hirimatāya samādapeti;

an4.202:5.4.pli: attanā ca ottappī hoti, parañca ottappe samādapeti;

an4.202:5.5.pli: attanā ca bahussuto hoti, parañca bāhusacce samādapeti;

an4.202:5.6.pli: attanā ca āraddhavīriyo hoti, parañca vīriyārambhe samādapeti;

an4.202:5.7.pli: attanā ca upaṭṭhitassati hoti, parañca satiupaṭṭhāne samādapeti;

an4.202:5.8.pli: attanā ca paññāsampanno hoti, parañca paññāsampadāya samādapeti.

an4.202:5.9.eng: This is called an even truer person.”

an4.203:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you an untrue person and an even more untrue person,

an4.203:1.2.eng: a true person and a truer person.

an4.203:2.1.eng: And what is an untrue person?

an4.203:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, pisuṇavāco hoti, pharusavāco hoti, samphappalāpī hoti.
an4.203:2.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, and uses speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical.

an4.203:2.3.eng: This is called an untrue person.

an4.203:3.1.eng: And what is an even more untrue person?

an4.203:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātī hoti, parañca pāṇātipāte samādapeti;
an4.203:3.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, and uses speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they encourage others to do these things.

an4.203:3.3.pli: attanā ca adinnādāyī hoti, parañca adinnādāne samādapeti;

an4.203:3.4.pli: attanā ca kāmesumicchācārī hoti, parañca kāmesumicchācāre samādapeti;

an4.203:3.5.pli: attanā ca musāvādī hoti, parañca musāvāde samādapeti;

an4.203:3.6.pli: attanā ca pisuṇavāco hoti, parañca pisuṇāya vācāya samādapeti;

an4.203:3.7.pli: attanā ca pharusavāco hoti, parañca pharusāya vācāya samādapeti;

an4.203:3.8.pli: attanā ca samphappalāpī hoti, parañca samphappalāpe samādapeti.

an4.203:3.9.eng: This is called an even more untrue person.

an4.203:4.1.eng: And what is a true person?

an4.203:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato, hoti, samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti.
an4.203:4.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical.

an4.203:4.3.eng: This is called a true person.

an4.203:5.1.eng: And what is an even truer person?

an4.203:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, parañca pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;
an4.203:5.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they encourage others to refrain from these things.

an4.203:5.3.pli: attanā ca adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, parañca adinnādānā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.203:5.4.pli: attanā ca kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, parañca kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.203:5.5.pli: attanā ca musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, parañca musāvādā veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.203:5.6.pli: attanā ca pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, parañca pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.203:5.7.pli: attanā ca pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, parañca pharusāya vācāya veramaṇiyā samādapeti;

an4.203:5.8.pli: attanā ca samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti, parañca samphappalāpā veramaṇiyā samādapeti.

an4.203:5.9.eng: This is called an even truer person.”

an4.204:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you an untrue person and an even more untrue person,

an4.204:1.2.eng: a true person and an even truer person.

an4.204:2.1.eng: And what is an untrue person?

an4.204:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, pisuṇavāco hoti, pharusavāco hoti, samphappalāpī hoti, abhijjhālu hoti, byāpannacitto hoti, micchādiṭṭhiko hoti.
an4.204:2.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view.

an4.204:2.3.eng: This is called an untrue person.

an4.204:3.1.eng: And what is an even more untrue person?

an4.204:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātī hoti, parañca pāṇātipāte samādapeti …pe… attanā ca abhijjhālu hoti, parañca abhijjhāya samādapeti;
an4.204:3.2.eng: It’s someone who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. They’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view. And they encourage others to do these things.

an4.204:3.3.pli: attanā ca byāpannacitto hoti, parañca byāpāde samādapeti, attanā ca micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca micchādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti.

an4.204:3.4.eng: This is called an even more untrue person.

an4.204:4.1.eng: And what is a true person?

an4.204:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… anabhijjhālu hoti, abyāpannacitto hoti, sammādiṭṭhiko hoti.
an4.204:4.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re contented, kind-hearted, with right view.

an4.204:4.3.eng: This is called a true person.

an4.204:5.1.eng: And what is an even truer person?

an4.204:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, parañca pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti …pe… attanā ca anabhijjhālu hoti, parañca anabhijjhāya samādapeti;
an4.204:5.2.eng: It’s someone who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. They’re contented, kind-hearted, with right view. And they encourage others to do these things.

an4.204:5.3.pli: attanā ca abyāpannacitto hoti, parañca abyāpāde samādapeti;

an4.204:5.4.pli: attanā ca sammādiṭṭhiko hoti, parañca sammādiṭṭhiyā samādapeti.

an4.204:5.5.eng: This is called an even truer person.”

an4.205:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you an untrue person and an even more untrue person,
